intro: Campynema neocaledonicum, commonly known as the New Caledonia campynema, is a rare and unique plant species native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Onocleaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories where it thrives in the humid climate. Its botanical features include a short, woody stem and inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked due to their size. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and environmental changes.
